00026 SimpleChatWidget::SimpleChatWidget(SimpleChatServer& server,
00027                                    Wt::WContainerWidget *parent)
00028   : WContainerWidget(parent),
00029     server_(server),
00030     app_(WApplication::instance()),
00031     messageReceived_("sounds/message_received.mp3")
00032 {
00033   user_ = server_.suggestGuest();
00034   letLogin();
00035 
00036   // this widget supports server-side updates its processChatEvent()
00037   // method is connected to a slot that is triggered from outside this
00038   // session's event loop (usually because another user enters text).
00039   app_->enableUpdates();
00040 }
00041 
00042 SimpleChatWidget::~SimpleChatWidget()
00043 {
00044   logout();
00045 }
00046 
00047 void SimpleChatWidget::letLogin()
00048 {
00049   clear();
00050 
00051   WVBoxLayout *vLayout = new WVBoxLayout();
00052   setLayout(vLayout, AlignLeft | AlignTop);
00053 
00054   WHBoxLayout *hLayout = new WHBoxLayout();
00055   vLayout->addLayout(hLayout);
00056 
00057   hLayout->addWidget(new WLabel("User name:"), 0, AlignMiddle);
00058   hLayout->addWidget(userNameEdit_ = new WLineEdit(user_), 0, AlignMiddle);
00059   userNameEdit_->setFocus();
00060 
00061   WPushButton *b = new WPushButton("Login");
00062   hLayout->addWidget(b, 0, AlignMiddle);
00063   hLayout->addStretch(1);
00064 
00065   b->clicked().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::login);
00066   userNameEdit_->enterPressed().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::login);
00067 
00068   vLayout->addWidget(statusMsg_ = new WText());
00069   statusMsg_->setTextFormat(PlainText);
00070 }
00071 
00072 void SimpleChatWidget::login()
00073 {
00074   WString name = WWebWidget::escapeText(userNameEdit_->text());
00075 
00076   if (!startChat(name))
00077     statusMsg_->setText("Sorry, name '" + name + "' is already taken.");
00078 }
00079 
00080 void SimpleChatWidget::logout()
00081 {
00082   if (eventConnection_.connected()) {
00083     eventConnection_.disconnect(); // do not listen for more events
00084     server_.logout(user_);
00085 
00086     letLogin();
00087   }
00088 }
00089 
00090 bool SimpleChatWidget::startChat(const WString& user)
00091 {
00092   if (server_.login(user)) {
00093     eventConnection_
00094       = server_.chatEvent().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::processChatEvent);
00095     user_ = user;    
00096 
00097     clear();
00098 
00099     /*
00100      * Create a vertical layout, which will hold 3 rows,
00101      * organized like this:
00102      *
00103      * WVBoxLayout
00104      * --------------------------------------------
00105      * | nested WHBoxLayout (vertical stretch=1)  |
00106      * |                              |           |
00107      * |  messages                    | userslist |
00108      * |   (horizontal stretch=1)     |           |
00109      * |                              |           |
00110      * --------------------------------------------
00111      * | message edit area                        |
00112      * --------------------------------------------
00113      * | WHBoxLayout                              |
00114      * | send | logout |       stretch = 1        |
00115      * --------------------------------------------
00116      */
00117     WVBoxLayout *vLayout = new WVBoxLayout();
00118 
00119     // Create a horizontal layout for the messages | userslist.
00120     WHBoxLayout *hLayout = new WHBoxLayout();
00121 
00122     // Add widget to horizontal layout with stretch = 1
00123     hLayout->addWidget(messages_ = new WContainerWidget(), 1);
00124     messages_->setStyleClass("chat-msgs");
00125     // Display scroll bars if contents overflows
00126     messages_->setOverflow(WContainerWidget::OverflowAuto);
00127 
00128     // Add another widget to hirozontal layout with stretch = 0
00129     hLayout->addWidget(userList_ = new WContainerWidget());
00130     userList_->setStyleClass("chat-users");
00131     userList_->setOverflow(WContainerWidget::OverflowAuto);
00132 
00133     hLayout->setResizable(0, true);
00134 
00135     // Add nested layout to vertical layout with stretch = 1
00136     vLayout->addLayout(hLayout, 1);
00137 
00138     // Add widget to vertical layout with stretch = 0
00139     vLayout->addWidget(messageEdit_ = new WTextArea());
00140     messageEdit_->setStyleClass("chat-noedit");
00141     messageEdit_->setRows(2);
00142     messageEdit_->setFocus();
00143 
00144     // Create a horizontal layout for the buttons.
00145     hLayout = new WHBoxLayout();
00146 
00147     // Add button to horizontal layout with stretch = 0
00148     hLayout->addWidget(sendButton_ = new WPushButton("Send"));
00149     WPushButton *b;
00150 
00151     // Add button to horizontal layout with stretch = 0
00152     hLayout->addWidget(b = new WPushButton("Logout"));
00153 
00154     // Add stretching spacer to horizontal layout
00155     hLayout->addStretch(1);
00156 
00157     // Add nested layout to vertical layout with stretch = 0
00158     vLayout->addLayout(hLayout);
00159 
00160     setLayout(vLayout);
00161 
00162     /*
00163      * Connect event handlers:
00164      *  - click on button
00165      *  - enter in text area
00166      *
00167      * We will clear the input field using a small custom client-side
00168      * JavaScript invocation.
00169      */
00170 
00171     // Create a JavaScript 'slot' (JSlot). The JavaScript slot always takes
00172     // 2 arguments: the originator of the event (in our case the
00173     // button or text area), and the JavaScript event object.
00174     clearInput_.setJavaScript
00175       ("function(o, e) {"
00176        "" + messageEdit_->jsRef() + ".value='';"
00177        "}");
00178 
00179     // Bind the C++ and JavaScript event handlers.
00180     sendButton_->clicked().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::send);
00181     messageEdit_->enterPressed().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::send);
00182     sendButton_->clicked().connect(clearInput_);
00183     messageEdit_->enterPressed().connect(clearInput_);
00184     sendButton_->clicked().connect(messageEdit_, &WLineEdit::setFocus);
00185     messageEdit_->enterPressed().connect(messageEdit_, &WLineEdit::setFocus);
00186 
00187     // Prevent the enter from generating a new line, which is its default
00188     // action
00189     messageEdit_->enterPressed().preventDefaultAction();
00190 
00191     b->clicked().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::logout);
00192 
00193     WText *msg = new WText
00194       ("<div><span class='chat-info'>You are joining the conversation as "
00195        + user_ + "</span></div>", messages_);
00196     msg->setStyleClass("chat-msg");
00197 
00198     updateUsers();
00199     
00200     return true;
00201   } else
00202     return false;
00203 }
00204 
00205 void SimpleChatWidget::send()
00206 {
00207   if (!messageEdit_->text().empty())
00208     server_.sendMessage(user_, messageEdit_->text());
00209 }
00210 
00211 void SimpleChatWidget::updateUsers()
00212 {
00213   userList_->clear();
00214 
00215   SimpleChatServer::UserSet users = server_.users();
00216 
00217   UserMap oldUsers = users_;
00218   users_.clear();
00219 
00220   for (SimpleChatServer::UserSet::iterator i = users.begin();
00221        i != users.end(); ++i) {
00222     WCheckBox *w = new WCheckBox(*i, userList_);
00223     w->setInline(false);
00224 
00225     UserMap::const_iterator j = oldUsers.find(*i);
00226     if (j != oldUsers.end())
00227       w->setChecked(j->second);
00228     else
00229       w->setChecked(true);
00230 
00231     users_[*i] = w->isChecked();
00232     w->changed().connect(this, &SimpleChatWidget::updateUser);
00233 
00234     if (*i == user_)
00235       w->setStyleClass("chat-self");
00236   }
00237 }
00238 
00239 void SimpleChatWidget::updateUser()
00240 {
00241   WCheckBox *b = dynamic_cast<WCheckBox *>(sender());
00242   users_[b->text()] = b->isChecked();
00243 }
00244 
00245 void SimpleChatWidget::processChatEvent(const ChatEvent& event)
00246 {
00247   /*
00248    * This is where the "server-push" happens. This method is called
00249    * when a new event or message needs to be notified to the user. In
00250    * general, it is called from another session.
00251    */
00252 
00253   /*
00254    * First, take the lock to safely manipulate the UI outside of the
00255    * normal event loop, by having exclusive access to the session.
00256    */
00257   WApplication::UpdateLock lock = app_->getUpdateLock();
00258 
00259   /*
00260    * Format and append the line to the conversation.
00261    *
00262    * This is also the step where the automatic XSS filtering will kick in:
00263    * - if another user tried to pass on some JavaScript, it is filtered away.
00264    * - if another user did not provide valid XHTML, the text is automatically
00265    *   interpreted as PlainText
00266    */
00267   bool needPush = false;
00268 
00269   /*
00270    * If it is not a normal message, also update the user list.
00271    */
00272   if (event.type() != ChatEvent::Message) {
00273     needPush = true;
00274     updateUsers();
00275   }
00276 
00277   bool display = event.type() != ChatEvent::Message
00278     || (users_.find(event.user()) != users_.end() && users_[event.user()]);
00279 
00280   if (display) {
00281     needPush = true;
00282 
00283     WText *w = new WText(event.formattedHTML(user_), messages_);
00284     w->setInline(false);
00285     w->setStyleClass("chat-msg");
00286 
00287     /*
00288      * Leave not more than 100 messages in the back-log
00289      */
00290     if (messages_->count() > 100)
00291       delete messages_->children()[0];
00292 
00293     /*
00294      * Little javascript trick to make sure we scroll along with new content
00295      */
00296     app_->doJavaScript(messages_->jsRef() + ".scrollTop += "
00297                        + messages_->jsRef() + ".scrollHeight;");
00298 
00299     /* If this message belongs to another user, play a received sound */
00300     if (event.user() != user_)
00301       messageReceived_.play();
00302   }
00303 
00304   if (needPush)
00305     app_->triggerUpdate();
00306 }
